subject: Leadership
title: The Ethical Leader's Daily Practice
description: A 60-second lesson on The Ethical Leader's Daily Practice.

hook.text: Ethics isn't a one-time decision. It's a daily practice, like exercise. Skip it and the muscle atrophies.

buildup.text: Badaracco's 'defining moments': small daily choices reveal and shape character more than dramatic one-time decisions.

discovery.text: An end-of-day ethical review: did I act with integrity? Where did I cut corners? What will I do differently tomorrow?

twist.text: Most leaders don't fail ethically in a single moment. They erode through a thousand forgettable small choices.

climax.text: Build ethical habits: a morning intention, a midday check-in, and an evening review. Small rituals protect big values.

punchline.text: Ethics is not a destination. It's a direction you walk in every day.

quiz.question: How do most ethical failures happen?
options: Through a thousand small forgettable choices that erode integrity
They happen randomly and can't be prevented
